intro: Aeschynomene falcata var. elegans, commonly known as the elegant sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, sickle-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are clustered in dense spikes and are usually pale yellow to greenish in color. It is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
